ghostPage.title: DSNP Software Development Kit (SDK)
ghostPage.excerpt:
If you’re new to DSNP development, this is the place to start. The Software
Development Kit offers the core features, communication facilitations, build
configurations, and common components for DSNP-enabled applications. This SDK
allows developers to quickly get started with the DSNP.

Download the SDK or clone it from our repository
[https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/sdk-ts] and start with the documentation
[https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/sdk-ts/blob/main/README.md]. Once you have the

ghostPage.meta_title: Decentralized Social Networking Protocol SDK - DSNP.org
ghostPage.meta_description: Download the DSNP Software Development Kit including code and example clients.
ghostPage.plaintext:
If you’re new to DSNP development, this is the place to start. The Software
Development Kit offers the core features, communication facilitations, build
configurations, and common components for DSNP-enabled applications. This SDK
allows developers to quickly get started with the DSNP.

Download the SDK or clone it from our repository
[https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/sdk-ts] and start with the documentation
[https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/sdk-ts/blob/main/README.md]. Once you have the
SDK, you might want to look at our Example Client
[https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/example-client] to start digging in to real,
running code. As always, check out the forums
[https://forums.projectliberty.io/] for help and to connect with other people
building on top of the DSNP.

The SDK is a work in progress. We could use your help with improving it,
especially the documentation. Please submit documentation PRs as you learn more
about how the SDK operates.
ghostPage.html:
If you’re new to DSNP development, this is the place to start. The Software Development Kit offers the core features, communication facilitations, build configurations, and common components for DSNP-enabled applications. This SDK allows developers to quickly get started with the DSNP.

Download the SDK or clone it from our repository and start with the documentation. Once you have the SDK, you might want to look at our Example Client to start digging in to real, running code. As always, check out the forums for help and to connect with other people building on top of the DSNP.

The SDK is a work in progress. We could use your help with improving it, especially the documentation. Please submit documentation PRs as you learn more about how the SDK operates.
